noSelfCompare.description:
Description

Disallow comparisons where both sides are exactly the same.
Comparing a variable against itself is usually an error, either a typo or refactoring error. It is confusing to the reader and may potentially introduce a runtime error.
The only time you would compare a variable against itself is when you are testing forNaN.
However, it is far more appropriate to usetypeof x === 'number' && Number.isNaN(x)for that use case rather than leaving the reader of the code to determine the intent of self comparison.
noSelfCompare.option: This rule has no specific options.
